Wave Goodbye Tour
Concert by Nine Inch Nails
Nine Inch Nails performing at the Virgin Festival in Toronto on August 30, 2009.
Start date February 17, 2009
End date September 10, 2009
Legs 5
No. of shows 78
37 in North America
28 in Europe
8 in Oceania
5 in Asia
1 cancellation
Nine Inch Nails concert chronology
  • Lights in the Sky Tour
    (2008)
  • Wave Goodbye Tour
    (2009)
  • Twenty Thirteen Tour
    (2013–2014)

Wave Goodbye Tour was a 2009 concert tour by industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails.

Contents

  • 1 Setlist
    • 1.1 Pretty Hate Machine era
    • 1.2 Broken era
    • 1.3 The Downward Spiral era
    • 1.4 The Fragile era
    • 1.5 With Teeth era
    • 1.6 Year Zero era
    • 1.7 The Slip era
  • 2 Tour dates
  • 3 Canceled dates
  • 4 Support acts
  • 5 Personnel
  • 6 External links

Setlist[edit]

Various NIN classics were played in this tour, alongside other songs such as "Piggy (Nothing Can Stop Me Now)" and "The Way Out Is Through".

Pretty Hate Machine era[edit]

  • "Head Like a Hole"
  • "Terrible Lie"
  • "Down in It"
  • "Something I Can Never Have"
  • "Sin"
  • "Get Down, Make Love"
  • "Now I'm Nothing"

Broken era[edit]

  • "Wish"
  • "Last"
  • "Gave Up"
  • "Physical (You're So)"
  • "Suck"

The Downward Spiral era[edit]

  • All "The Downward Spiral's" songs
  • "Dead Souls"
  • "Burn"
  • "Piggy (Nothing Can Stop Me Now)"

The Fragile era[edit]

  • "Somewhat Damaged"
  • "The Day the World Went Away"
  • "The Frail"
  • "The Wretched"
  • "The Fragile"
  • "Just Like You Imagined"
  • "La Mer"
  • "The Way Out Is Through"
  • "The Big Come Down"
  • "Metal"
  • "Gone, Still"

With Teeth era[edit]

  • "The Collector"
  • "The Hand That Feeds"
  • "Home"
  • "The Line Begins To Blur"
  • "Right Where It Belongs"
  • "Not So Pretty Now"
  • "Non-Entity"

Year Zero era[edit]

  • "The Beginning Of The End"
  • "Survivalism"
  • "The Good Soldier"
  • "Me, I'm Not"
  • "The Warning"
  • "Meet Your Master"
  • "In This Twilight"

The Slip era[edit]

  • "1,000,000"
  • "Letting You"
  • "Discipline"
  • "Echoplex"
  • "Head Down"
  • "Lights in the Sky"

Canceled dates[edit]

Date City Country Venue R
August 12, 2009 Taipei Taiwan Nan-Kang 101 [a]
  • a^ Date canceled due to "production and venue issues".

Support acts[edit]

  • Alec Empire (June 23 and 24, 2009; July 20, 24–30, 2009)
  • Animal Collective (Rome)
  • Health (September 6–10, 2009)
  • The Horrors (August 22–25, 2009)
  • Jaguar Love (February 24 and 25, 2009)
  • Jane's Addiction (May 8–July 20, 2009)
  • Mew (June 29–July 15, 2009; August 26–September 2, 2009)
  • The Naked and Famous (Auckland)
  • Street Sweeper Social Club (May 8–June 12, 2009)
  • TV on the Radio (Rome)

Personnel[edit]

  • Trent Reznor – lead vocals, guitars, bass, keyboards, synthesizers
  • Robin Finck – guitars, synthesizers
  • Justin Meldal-Johnsen – electric and double bass, guitars, synthesizers
  • Ilan Rubin – drums, keyboards
